parameters.description:
Indicates when the SAS URL should be included with the response

schema.description:
Indicates when the SAS URL to retrieve the results should be included on the job response

  • Never - Never
  • OnceRunning - When the job has status Running or Completed
  • OnceCompleted - When the job has status Completed

  • Attachment - The content will be downloaded and saved locally

Address to use for when no address is found. Null if using Blank address

Members:

  • SpecificAddressType
  • SpousePreferred
  • SpousePrimaryBusiness
  • PrimaryBusiness
  • FirstInList
  • Preferred
  • None

specific_address_type_id.description: The address type from the address types code table to use when the AddressTypeEnum is set to SpecificAddressType

AddressTypeOrEnum.description:
Denotes which address to use for the address processing when one isn't found.
If the Enum is SpecificAddressType, then the SpecificAddressTypeId is used.

use_alternate_sql_code_table_fields.description: Use alternate SQL method for code table fields

use_alternate_sql_multiple_attributes.description: Use alternate SQL method for multiple attributes

filter_values.description:
Values for the filter.

The filter operator determines the required number of values:
- Blank, NotBlank, Ask, Any: No values
- OneOf, NotOneOf, OneOfEach: One or more values
- Between, NotBetween: Two values in the desired order
- All others: One value

The value_type of the query field determines the type of the value(s):
- Text: string, int32, or double, depending on the field
- Boolean: boolean
- Date: date-time or one of the relative date values for Date fields listed below
- FuzzyDate: FuzzyDate (an object with optional properties "day", "month", and "year") or one of the relative date values for FuzzyDate fields listed below. 
    The query field's additional_properties entry for yearRequired indicates whether or not the year is required when filtering by a specific FuzzyDate.
- TableEntry, Lookup, Search, and StaticEntry: An object with properties "id" and "description" on GET; int32 on POST/PATCH (the ID of the record on which to filter)
- Summary: Not yet supported

- Today
- Yesterday
- Tomorrow
- ThisWeek
- LastWeek
- NextWeek
- ThisMonth
- LastMonth
- NextMonth
- MonthToDate
- ThisQuarter

The month values will match any fuzzy dates with that month (any year).

ux_mode.description:
The UXMode of the request. Defaults to Asynchronous.

Members:

  • Synchronous - Use this mode when an end-user is waiting on the job results. The consumer will poll the job status until completion. If the job gets throttled, you will receive a 429 response and the job will not be queued. NOTE: You must poll the job status using GET Query execution job at least every 10 seconds until the job completes or the job will be cancelled due to inactivity.
  • Asynchronous - Use this mode when no end-user is waiting on the job results. The consumer will poll the job status until completion. If the job gets throttled, the job will still be queued, up to a cap on the number of queued jobs. (There are no polling requirements in this mode.)

output_format.description:
The OutputFormat of the request. Defaults to Csv.

Members:

  • Csv - Comma-separated values
  • Json - JSON array
  • Jsonl - JSON lines
  • Xlsx - Excel

formatting_mode.description:
The FormattingMode to apply to the results. Defaults to None.

Members:

  • None - Do not apply any formatting to the values retrieved from the SQL
  • UI - Use formatting rules appropriate for displaying the results in the UI
  • Export - Use formatting rules appropriate for an export

sql_generation_mode.description:
SQL generation mode, affecting select fields. Defaults to Query.

Members:

  • Query - Use the query's select fields plus QRECID
  • Export - Use the query's select fields without adding QRECID
  • Report - Only select QRECID

use_static_query_id_set.description:
When false, the query is run dynamically regardless of its format (dynamic or static).
When true, the results only include the records in the static query's saved ID set.
True is only valid for static queries that have a saved ID set.  For a static query to have a saved ID set, one of the following must be true:
- The query was created or its format was changed to static in database view.
- The query was created or its format was changed to static via the web view UI.
- The query was created via the query API, POST /queries/refreshstaticquery was called for it, and that job completed successfully.

select_fields.description:
The select fields of the query (SELECT clause).
If this property is specified on a PATCH request, you must provide all the desired items in the collection with all the desired properties.
The collection you provide will fully overwrite the existing collection.
This is different from standard PATCH collection handling, where only the key values of items in
the collection are required to retain existing items.

filter_fields.description:
The filter fields of the query (WHERE clause).
If this property is specified on a PATCH request, you must provide all the desired items in the collection with all the desired properties.
The collection you provide will fully overwrite the existing collection.
This is different from standard PATCH collection handling, where only the key values of items in
the collection are required to retain existing items.

sort_fields.description:
The sort fields of the query (ORDER BY clause).
If this property is specified on a PATCH request, you must provide all the desired items in the collection with all the desired properties.
The collection you provide will fully overwrite the existing collection.
This is different from standard PATCH collection handling, where only the key values of items in
the collection are required to retain existing items.

summary_fields.description:
The summary fields of the query, which are typically aggregations or totals related to the query record type.
The objects present in this collection must have unique combinations of query_field_id and summary_instance.
When making any changes to the filter fields or summary fields of a query with summary fields or filter fields, all the following rules apply:
- All of summary fields and filter fields must be provided provided in the request.
- If one or more select fields reference a summary field, the entire select fields collection must be provided in the request as well. Note that this means providing all of filter_fields, select_fields, and summary_fields.
- Sort fields are handled the same as select fields. Note that for queries with summary fields in both select_fields and sort_fields, all of filter_fields, summary_fields, select_fields, and sort_fields must be provided on the request to make any changes to any of the collections.

status.description:
The status of the job

Members:

  • Pending - The job has been queued but has not yet started running.
  • Running - The job is running.
  • Completed - The job successfully completed.
  • Failed - The job failed.
  • Cancelling - Job cancellation has been requested. The job may still complete successfully from this state.
  • Cancelled - The job was cancelled.
  • Throttled - The job has been throttled. The job will run when space is available.

sas_uri.description:
SAS URI for accessing the query results.
The URI functions as a secure credential to access the query results, and thus should be considered a secret unique value.
Sharing this URI with anyone is strongly discouraged, and as a best practice, avoid persisting the URI beyond processing the job result.
The URI will expire after 15 minutes.

row_count.description: The number of rows found by the query

QueryExecutionJob.description: A background job for executing a query

available_field_name.description: The name of the field to display in the available fields list

selected_field_name.description: The name of the field to display when the field is selected for filter, output, or sort

unique_id.description: The attribute type ID, or the specific type ID

value_type.description:
The QueryValueType for this field.

Members:

  • Text - Text value (string, number, etc.) that doesn't have a list of values or other special functionality (date, search, etc.)
  • Boolean - Combo box with Yes and No values
  • Date - Absolute/relative date options
  • FuzzyDate - Absolute/relative fuzzy date options
  • TableEntry - Combo box displaying values from a code table lookup
  • Lookup - Combo box displaying values from a table lookup
  • Search - Search field

ux_mode.description:
The UXMode of the request. Defaults to Asynchronous.

Members:

  • Synchronous - Use this mode when an end-user is waiting on the job results. The consumer will poll the job status until completion. If the job gets throttled, you will receive a 429 response and the job will not be queued. NOTE: You must poll the job status using GET Query execution job at least every 10 seconds until the job completes or the job will be cancelled due to inactivity.
  • Asynchronous - Use this mode when no end-user is waiting on the job results. The consumer will poll the job status until completion. If the job gets throttled, the job will still be queued, up to a cap on the number of queued jobs. (There are no polling requirements in this mode.)

summary_instance.description:
An additional identifier to differentiate multiple instances of the same summary field (query_field_id) used on a query.
The combinations of query_field_id and summary_instance must be unique in the collection of summary_fields on a query.
This value becomes part of the field name in the query UI (again, to differentiate multiple instances of the same summary field on the query),
so it is recommended to start your sequence at 1 for each query_field_id and proceed sequentially for any additional instances of the same query_field_id.
